text:
The Hidden Cost of Renewables: Modern Slavery in Ethanol supply chain





Renewables are not completely clean energy. Companies in the biofuel supply chain are on the “dirty list” using slave labor or conditions analogous to slavery





Jan 29, 2025


Edgar Rodriguez-Huerta


2 min






No matching items

title: Dr. Marifer Rocha Arrangoiz
text:
Hi, I’m Marifer, and as a Highly Sensitive Person, I deeply care about others, and this trait gives my life meaning and purpose. In every session, I strive to create a positive impact—not just for the individuals I work with, but for the world as a whole and future generations. When we liberate ourselves from the negative relational cycles in our more meaningful relationships, we get out from a constant suffering and we start contributing to a better and more compassionate world.
With a deep foundation in Attachment Theory, I am passionate about meeting people where they are emotionally, providing support with empathy, and guiding them towards greater comfort and meaningful connections with themselves and others.
My dedication to this profession has been the driving force of my life. Apart from my Bachelor in Psychology, I hold a Doctorate in Clinical Psychology, both earned with honours. I also hold a Master’s degree in Clinical Psychology, during which I participated in an International Mobility Program and received a scholarship from the National Council for Science and Technology (CONACYT). Committed to continuous learning and specialization, I have gained extensive experience working in institutional clinics, teaching at universities, and practicing privately with individuals and couples using the Emotionally Focused Therapy (EFT), model developed by Dr. Sue Johnson.
Both in my professional journey and in my life as a mother and wife, my mission is to use my humanity to help people embrace their inner vulnerability and to use it to connect with themselves and with others, having the certainty that this will foster a powerful and unbreakable chain of human connection and well-being in the world.
I would be honored to meet you, support you in your emotional journey, and walk alongside you in this shared mission of connection.









You were there for me when I was first facing depression and anxiety, and also when you insisted that my parents take family therapy. I remember how committed you were to helping me improve things at home, even when they decided not to continue with therapy.
I am now financially independent, I have a new job that I like, I don’t need pills for my depression and anxiety, and in general, I don’t think I’ve ever been as good with myself as I am now. Your support in those years of therapy really made a difference in my life. I don’t think I would have gotten this far without your help, and that’s why I wanted to say: Thank you!
J.V.









Marifer, I want to thank you for everything, for listening to me, for knowing how to be my psychologist, for taking care of me when I had a crisis, for not leaving me alone, I really value the work you do, you are an excellent psychologist from the day I met you I was delighted with your work, you know how to listen, advise, you are tactful with every thing and word you say, thank you for taking care of me and accepting to be my psychologist, because I didn’t want to be alive anymore, but you helped me and gave me courage to do so, and to understand many things that I didn’t understand before, now I want so many things that before didn’t even cross my mind, I really want to live, I am very, very grateful to you that I don’t know how to explain it, may God always bless you, and thank you for dedicating yourself to this, which I am sure has helped many people and now they want to continue living and appreciating how beautiful life is, I love you very much and I send you many hugs now that I can, because I thought I would not make it to today ❤
T.









Your support pushed me to pursue the goals I had. You have been the person who has supported me the most. I am very happy and grateful for everything you have done for me, and above all, it is so real that you like to help people. Thank you!!
GM

title: Mudanças climáticas e riscos ambientais: Calor excessivo
text: Série de seis infográficos que descrevem os principais riscos à saúde dos trabalhadores relacionados às mudanças climáticas e ao meio ambiente International Labour Organization (ILO) 2024

title: Mudanças climáticas e riscos ambientais: Calor excessivo
text: Em breve

title: Mudanças climáticas e riscos ambientais: Calor excessivo
text:
Download


[Baixe em alta resolução]
[Olhe dentro do código]


Compartilhe em redes sociais:

title: O custo oculto das energias renováveis: Pessoas Em Condição Análoga À De Escravo na cadeia de fornecimento de Etanol
text:
Escravizado do Etanol
O etanol é amplamente reconhecido como uma solução importante para reduzir as emissões de gases de efeito estufa no setor de transporte e combater as mudanças climáticas. Como segundo maior produtor de etanol, o Brasil desempenha um papel significativo na indústria global de biocombustíveis. Entretanto, apesar de seus benefícios ambientais, a produção de etanol levanta sérias preocupações em relação aos direitos trabalhistas, saúde ocupacional e justiça social. O relatório recente Escravizado do Etanol by Reportér Brasil highlights the exploitation and unsafe working conditions faced by sugarcane workers.

“Trabalhadores mortos em queimadas, obrigados a dormir no chão, forçados a trabalhar por conta de dívidas ilegais impostas pelo empregador e até mesmo atingidos por agrotóxicos lançados de aviões estão entre as situações reportadas em canaviais ligados às suas operações.”

Muitos trabalhadores são submetidos à servidão por dívidas e salários imprevisíveis devido a deduções injustas, pagando suas próprias viagens, acomodações e alimentação. Além disso, horários de trabalho extremos e a falta de contratos formais negam aos trabalhadores o acesso a benefícios essenciais da previdência social. Alguns trabalhadores relatam dormir apenas quatro horas por noite, pois longos deslocamentos e turnos exaustivos impossibilitam um descanso adequado. Além disso, os trabalhadores da cana-de-açúcar são frequentemente expostos a pesticidas perigosos, sofrem esforços físicos intensos e correm altos riscos de doenças relacionadas ao calor.

“Durante resgate ocorrido em fazendas de cinco municípios de Goiás e Minas Gerais, trabalhadores relataram aos fiscais que foram atingidos por agrotóxicos. Na foto, tirada pelo celular de um deles, é possível ver o avião que supostamente realizou a pulverização”




Fonte: Escravizado do Etanol. Trabalhadores relataram aos inspetores que foram pulverizados com pesticidas


Enfrentar esses desafios exige uma aplicação mais rigorosa das leis trabalhistas, maior responsabilização corporativa e melhor supervisão nas cadeias de suprimentos. Uma transição justa na indústria do etanol deve priorizar não apenas a sustentabilidade ambiental, mas também a proteção dos direitos e do bem-estar dos trabalhadores. Governos, empresas e instituições financeiras devem tomar medidas decisivas para eliminar a escravidão moderna, garantir salários justos e fornecer condições de trabalho seguras. O etanol pode ser uma alternativa de combustível mais limpa, mas não deve ser feito à custa de vidas humanas, dignidade e direitos trabalhistas fundamentais.


Share it on social media:





















ReusoCC BY 4.0

title: The Hidden Cost of Renewables: Modern Slavery in Ethanol supply chain
text:
Enslaved in Ethanol
Ethanol is widely recognized as a important solution to reducing greenhouse gas emissions in transport sector and combating climate change. As the second-largest ethanol producer, Brazil plays a significant role in the global biofuel industry. However, despite its environmental benefits, ethanol production raises serious concerns regarding labour rights, occupational health, and social justice. The recent report Enslaved in Ethanol by Reportér Brasil highlights the exploitation and unsafe working conditions faced by sugarcane workers.

“The situations reported in sugarcane fields linked to their operations include workers killed in fires, forced to sleep on the ground, unable to leave their jobs because of illegal debts imposed by their employers, and even hit by pesticides dropped from airplanes.”

Many workers are subjected to debt bondage and unpredictable wages due to unfair deductions, paying for their own travel, accommodation, and food. Additionally, extreme working hours and lack of formal contracts deny workers access to essential social security benefits. Some workers report sleeping only four hours a night, as long commutes and exhausting shifts make proper rest impossible. Moreover, sugarcane workers are frequently exposed to hazardous pesticides, experience severe physical effort, and high risks of heat-related illnesses.

“Workers reported to inspectors that they had been sprayed on with pesticides. The plane that allegedly did the spraying can be seen in the photo taken by one of them on his cell phone.”




Source: Enslaved in Ethanol. Workers reported to inspectors that they had been sprayed on with pesticides


Addressing these challenges requires stronger enforcement of labour laws, greater corporate accountability, and improved oversight in supply chains. A just transition in the ethanol industry must prioritize not only environmental sustainability but also the protection of workers’ rights and well-being. Governments, companies, and financial institutions must take decisive action to eliminate modern slavery, ensure fair wages, and provide safe working conditions. Ethanol may be a cleaner fuel alternative, but it must not come at the cost of human lives, dignity and fundamental labour rights.


Share it on social media:





















ReuseCC BY 4.0

title: Marifer Rocha Arrangoiz, PhD
text:
Hola, yo soy Marifer. Soy una Persona Altamente Sensible, algo que hace que me importe mucho lo que hago por los demás y lo que pasa a mi alrededor; creo que esta es mi característica principal que me hace ser quien soy y que me da sentido y propósito como ser humano. Mi profesión es mi forma de ayudar a que este mundo sea un poco mejor para nosotros y para nuestras futuras generaciones; estoy segura de que cada persona que se libera de un sufrimiento constante tras romper los ciclos negativos en sus relaciones más importantes, contribuye a que otras personas crezcan también emocionalmente y se multiplique el bienestar en el mundo.
La Psicología, y específicamente la Teoría del Apego, me dieron un mapa para poder saber cómo conectarme emocionalmente con las personas y guiarlas hacia el alivio y la conexión con ellas mismas y con los demás.
Descubrir esto ha sido tan apasionante para mí, que he logrado conseguir el apoyo de personas e Instituciones que me han permitido seguir especializándome cada vez más. Tengo la Licenciatura y el Doctorado en Psicología, ambos terminados con honores, y una Maestría en Psicología Clínica que hice en dos universidades gracias a ser parte de un acuerdo bilateral internacional. Para poder cursar mi Maestría y mi Doctorado en el extranjero, tuve el apoyo de una Beca por parte del Consejo Nacional de Ciencia y Tecnología. Desde entonces, he trabajado en Clínicas de Psicología Institucionales, he trabajado como Docente de Psicología en diferentes Universidades y he trabajado como independiente dando psicoterapia a parejas y a adultos en terapia individual, con la ayuda del modelo de la Terapia Focalizada en las Emociones (TFE), desarrollado por la Dra. Sue Johnson.
Mi misión en mi vida como esposa, como mamá y como psicóloga, es usar mi propia vulnerabilidad para ayudar a las personas a sobrevivir con las suya; teniendo la certeza de que esto va a crear una cadena inquebrantable de conexión humana y bienestar en el mundo.
Será un honor para mí conocerte, acompañarte y que te sumes a esta gran misión de conexión y bienestar en el mundo.









Me acompañaste cuando enfrentaba por primera vez la depresión y la ansiedad, y también cuando insististe en que mis padres tomaran terapia familiar. Recuerdo lo comprometida que estabas con ayudarme a mejorar las cosas en casa, incluso cuando ellos decidieron no continuar con la terapia.
Actualmente ya soy independiente económicamente, tengo un nuevo trabajo que me gusta, no necesito las pastillas para mi depresión y ansiedad, y en general, creo que nunca había estado tan bien conmigo como ahora. Tu apoyo en aquellos años de terapia realmente marcó un cambio en mi vida. No creo que hubiese llegado hasta aquí sin tu ayuda, y por eso quería decirte: ¡Gracias!
J.V.









Marifer, quiero darle las gracias por todo, por escucharme, por saber ser mi psicóloga, por atenderme cuando tuve crisis, por no dejarme sola, valoro muchísimo el trabajo que usted hace, es una excelente psicóloga desde el día uno que la conocí quedé encantada con su trabajo, sabe escuchar, aconsejar, tiene tacto con cada cosa y palabra que dice, gracias por atenderme y aceptar ser mi psicóloga, porque yo ya no quería estar más viva, pero usted me ayudó y dio valor para hacerlo, y entender muchas cosas que antes no entendía, ahora tengo ganas de tantas cosas que antes ni siquiera se me pasaban por la cabeza, tengo muchas ganas de vivir, estoy muy muy agradecida con usted que no sé cómo explicarlo, que Dios la bendiga siempre, y gracias por dedicarse a esto, que estoy segura que a ayudado a muchas personas y ahora tienen ganas de seguir viviendo y valorando lo hermosa que es la vida, la quiero mucho y le mando muchos abrazos ahora que puedo, porque pensé que no llegaría al día de hoy ❤️
T









Tu apoyo me empujó para buscar los objetivos que tenía. Has sido la persona que más me ha apoyado estoy muy contento y agradecido por todo lo que has hecho por mi, y sobre todo que es algo tan real que te gusta ayudar a las personas. Gracias!!
GM
